nodes.bodyText:
Sort of. I'm not sure how to name this bundle because I can't can't just rename the javax imports to jakarta because some of the methods WebContainer.  Those WebContainer methods use javax.servlet.* classes because of the interfaces they implement.
Instead, I use the 2.3.6 project on the build path  and then transform this bundle.  It's not used by the 2.3. feature, but the faces 3.0 feature uses these IBM classes from the 2.3 bundle.  I'm talking to Paul about possibly having the jsf 2.3 and jsf 3.0 features using this as a shared bundle.

nodes.bodyText:
Asked in the Jakarta Channel. They said to use exact.
EXACT - When this strategy is used, the version range must be a single version which is the version which is searched for. If multiple repositories contain the the exact version of the artifact, the artifact from the first repository is used.

nodes.bodyText: Given that this is a renamed feature io.openliberty and uses faces instead of jsf we need to make sure this and the other jsf provider features can't be loaded at the same time.  Have we done any testing? Perhaps a discussion in the jakarta channel is necessary as there are likely other providers that have hit the same issue. For example I fear we would be able to load the jsfContainer-2.3 feature and the faces-3.0 feature at the same time.
